repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
**Problem**: `:InspectTree` doesn't correctly handle nested injections

Using nvim-treesitter, we can have a codeblock of
```html
<script> 
const x = html`<ge></ge>`
</script>
```
that will be rendered as the image: ![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/29790821/c95be05a-9dc6-4f8e-8770-fab951c3fcb9)


This was because of the codeblock below https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/315c711700a87fe3fa546906ab39557ebba19baf/runtime/lua/vim/treesitter/dev.lua#L104-L115

When we check for an injection, we only consider it to be a child of the root tree, and didn't check whether it was a child of another injection tree.

**Solution**: During initial creation of `TSTreeView`, Iterate over all root trees to get their injections, not just the root tree. For each overlapping tree of a parent tree, Keep the injection tree with the biggest range as the child.

Potential issues:
- The old nvim-treesitter-playground implementation has all injections for a range shown, should this be followed?
- How exactly can we find the tree with the biggest range? I used to try `child:trees()[1]:root()`, but this sometimes break while messing with a large enough file. Because of that, I opted for iterating every injected tree of a child, which is sometimes unnecessary.

fixes #26084 

| Before | After |
| - | - |
| ![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/29790821/c95be05a-9dc6-4f8e-8770-fab951c3fcb9) | ![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/29790821/9490c294-3c35-44e2-9059-3fbd1a96f46f) |

comment_data.body: I don't know if the inner injected trees are parsed before or after the outer ones. If the order are outer -> inner, then I will remove the if accordingly
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -99,22 +99,44 @@ function TSTreeView:new(bufnr, lang)
   -- For each child tree (injected language), find the root of the tree and locate the node within
   -- the primary tree that contains that root. Add a mapping from the node in the primary tree to
   -- the root in the child tree to the {injections} table.
-  local root = parser:parse(true)[1]:root()
-  local injections = {} ---@type table<integer,table>
-  for _, child in pairs(parser:children()) do
-    child:for_each_tree(function(tree, ltree)
-      local r = tree:root()
-      local node = root:named_descendant_for_range(r:range())
-      if node then
-        injections[node:id()] = {
-          lang = ltree:lang(),
-          root = r,
-        }
-      end
-    end)
+  local tstrees = parser:parse(true)
+  local injections = {} ---@type table<integer,{lang: string, root: TSNode}>
+
+  ---@param node TSNode
+  ---@return number
+  local function node_length(node)
+    local _, _, start_byte = node:start()
+    local _, _, end_byte = node:end_()
+    return end_byte - start_byte
   end
+  parser:for_each_tree(function(root_tree, root_ltree)
+    local root = root_tree:root()
+    for _, child in pairs(root_ltree:children()) do
+      child:for_each_tree(function(tree, ltree)
+        local r = tree:root()
+        local node = root:named_descendant_for_range(r:range())
+        if node then
+          if injections[node:id()] then

comment_data.body: This seems unsafe but I don't know. I'm just expecting the first tree to be the root tree and not anything else

-      local node = root:named_descendant_for_range(r:range())

+
+  ---@param node TSNode

+    local _, _, end_byte = node:end_()
+    return end_byte - start_byte
+  end
+  parser:for_each_tree(function(parent_tree, parent_ltree)
+    local parent = parent_tree:root()
+    for _, child in pairs(parent_ltree:children()) do
+      local r = child:trees()[1]:root()

comment_data.body:
Do you have an example where comparing the node lengths is necessary? I tried changing this check to

```lua
if node and not injections[node:id()] then
```

and both examples in this PR still work as expected.

I am wondering if we can simplify this by removing the `node_length` check completely.

comment_data.body:
I don't know the exact order of child tree iteration, so I opted to compare the node length

As `for_each_tree` uses `pairs()`, the iterating order of the trees is not guaranteed to be outermost->innermost. If I understand this incorrectly then I will remove node_length
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -100,19 +100,41 @@ function TSTreeView:new(bufnr, lang)
   -- the primary tree that contains that root. Add a mapping from the node in the primary tree to
   -- the root in the child tree to the {injections} table.
   local root = parser:parse(true)[1]:root()
-  local injections = {} ---@type table<integer,table>
-  for _, child in pairs(parser:children()) do
-    child:for_each_tree(function(tree, ltree)
-      local r = tree:root()
-      local node = root:named_descendant_for_range(r:range())
-      if node then
-        injections[node:id()] = {
-          lang = ltree:lang(),
-          root = r,
-        }
-      end
-    end)
+  local injections = {} ---@type table<integer,{lang: string, root: TSNode}>
+
+  ---@param node TSNode
+  ---@return number
+  local function node_length(node)
+    local _, _, start_byte = node:start()
+    local _, _, end_byte = node:end_()
+    return end_byte - start_byte
   end
+  parser:for_each_tree(function(parent_tree, parent_ltree)
+    local parent = parent_tree:root()
+    for _, child in pairs(parent_ltree:children()) do
+      child:for_each_tree(function(tree, ltree)
+        local r = tree:root()
+        local node = parent:named_descendant_for_range(r:range())
+        if node then
+          if injections[node:id()] then

comment_data.body:
Ok, I think you're right that it's safer not to assume the iteration order.

I don't like this `node_length` function, I'd prefer to have it as a method on TSNode or in the Range module instead, but we can do that in a follow up. Two changes I want to make here in this PR:

1. Store the size of the current injection in the `injections` table to make it easier/cheaper to compare in each iteration
2. `assert` that `named_descendant_for_range` is non-nil (it won't ever be nil)

```diff
-        local node = parent:named_descendant_for_range(r:range())
-        if node then
-          if injections[node:id()] then
-            local old_r = injections[node:id()].root
-            -- Keep the outermost tree, as this is most likely the parent's tree
-            if node_length(r) >= node_length(old_r) then
-              injections[node:id()] = {
-                lang = ltree:lang(),
-                root = r,
-              }
-            end
-          else
-            injections[node:id()] = {
-              lang = ltree:lang(),
-              root = r,
-            }
-          end
+        local node = assert(parent:named_descendant_for_range(r:range()))
+        local id = node:id()
+        local size = node_length(r)
+        if not injections[id] or size > injections[id].size then
+          injections[id] = {
+            lang = ltree:lang(),
+            root = r,
+            size = size,
+          }
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -100,19 +100,41 @@ function TSTreeView:new(bufnr, lang)
   -- the primary tree that contains that root. Add a mapping from the node in the primary tree to
   -- the root in the child tree to the {injections} table.
   local root = parser:parse(true)[1]:root()
-  local injections = {} ---@type table<integer,table>
-  for _, child in pairs(parser:children()) do
-    child:for_each_tree(function(tree, ltree)
-      local r = tree:root()
-      local node = root:named_descendant_for_range(r:range())
-      if node then
-        injections[node:id()] = {
-          lang = ltree:lang(),
-          root = r,
-        }
-      end
-    end)
+  local injections = {} ---@type table<integer,{lang: string, root: TSNode}>
+
+  ---@param node TSNode
+  ---@return number
+  local function node_length(node)
+    local _, _, start_byte = node:start()
+    local _, _, end_byte = node:end_()
+    return end_byte - start_byte
   end
+  parser:for_each_tree(function(parent_tree, parent_ltree)
+    local parent = parent_tree:root()
+    for _, child in pairs(parent_ltree:children()) do
+      child:for_each_tree(function(tree, ltree)
+        local r = tree:root()
+        local node = parent:named_descendant_for_range(r:range())
+        if node then
+          if injections[node:id()] then

comment_data.body:
Well what do you know, there already exists a `:byte_length()` method on `TSNode`, it's just undocumented. So you can replace `node_length(r)` with `r:byte_length()`. Since the byte length is computed in C it should be fast enough that we don't need to cache it.

New diff:

```diff
-        local node = parent:named_descendant_for_range(r:range())
-        if node then
-          if injections[node:id()] then
-            local old_r = injections[node:id()].root
-            -- Keep the outermost tree, as this is most likely the parent's tree
-            if node_length(r) >= node_length(old_r) then
-              injections[node:id()] = {
-                lang = ltree:lang(),
-                root = r,
-              }
-            end
-          else
-            injections[node:id()] = {
-              lang = ltree:lang(),
-              root = r,
-            }
-          end
+        local node = assert(parent:named_descendant_for_range(r:range()))
+        local id = node:id()
+        if not injections[id] or r:byte_length() > injections[id].root:byte_length() then
+          injections[id] = {
+            lang = ltree:lang(),
+            root = r,
+          }
```

comment_regular_data.body:
Thank you for fixing this, I have also run into this problem with nested injected languages. 

Have you tried something more complicated like the following in a markdown file? (remove the `;` before ```, I just added them so it shows up nicely in GitHub)

```markdown
Markdown
;```markdown
Injected markdown.
~~~lua
print 'Injected Lua'
print({{{{}}}})
vim.cmd[[echo str([])]]
vim.cmd[[
echo 'Injected vim in injected Lua'
echo str([])
]]
~~~
More injected markdown.
;```
```

(Also, did you double check that the languages are as you expected when you press `I` in the `InspectTree` window to have the language of each line listed?)

> Have you tried something more complicated like the following in a markdown file? (remove the ; before ```, I just added them so it shows up nicely in GitHub)

It's not more complicated than my example. It's still just nested injections.

Fwiw, here's the result of your code. 
![image](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/assets/29790821/b0a5b6a8-9655-4b89-86f4-6aab3ce19bc1)

> It's not more complicated than my example. It's still just nested injections.

It is still just nested injections, yes. What I meant with more complicated was really just deeper nesting + multiple injections of the same language at the same nesting level. In particular, I have run into a problem with multiple injections of the same language at the same nesting level before, so I thought it would be worth testing.  

> Fwiw, here's the result of your code. 

Thank you. That looks like I would expect for that part.

> I have run into a problem with multiple injections of the same language at the same nesting level before, so I thought it would be worth testing.

If this still happens for nvim-treesitter, make sure to send a PR :D. We tried very aggressively to not have a node be injected with two languages (bar comment nodes).

performed_via_github_app.description: Automate your workflow from idea to production
performed_via_github_app.name: GitHub Actions

comment_regular_data.body:
> If this still happens for nvim-treesitter, make sure to send a PR :D. We tried very aggressively to not have a node be injected with two languages (bar comment nodes).

I think my explanation was unclear. I have run into this issue before in a plugin, I haven't noticed an issue like that in the neovim core. Also, with two languages at the same level I meant something like this:
~~~markdown
Markdown
```lua
-- one lua block
local a = 1
```
more markdown
```lua
-- second lua block at "same nesting level"
local b = 2
```
~~~
But if I notice any issue with treesitter (I have been doing a lot of stuff with treesitter recently) in neovim, I will try to make a pull request. :)

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(treesitter): make InspectTree correctly handle nested injections
